providing fees to liquidity makers (users on both sides of order book)","kind":"dev","methods":{},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"changeAdmin(address)":{"notice":"MULTISIG ADMIN To incentivise balance, more value goes to the weaker side in proportion to how imbalanced the market is."},"getShortBeta(uint32)":{"notice":"Returns % of short position that is filled zero div error if both are zero"},"getTreasurySplit(uint32,uint256)":{"notice":"Returns the amount of accrued value that should go to the market, and the amount that should be locked into the treasury. deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
@dev {LongShort} contract:**** visit https://float.capital *****
  - Ability for users to create synthetic long and short positions on value movements
  - Value movements could be derived from tradional or alternative asset classes, derivates, binary outcomes, etc...
  - Incentive mechansim providing fees to liquidity makers (users on both sides of order book)
Necessary to update system state before any contract actions (deposits / withdraws)
MULTISIG ADMIN FUNCTIONS ///////

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory,string memory,address) external returns (contract SyntheticToken)
function (string memory,string memory,address) external returns (contract SyntheticToken)

documentation.text:
Creates an entirely new long/short market tracking an underlying
 oracle price. Make sure the synthetic names/symbols are unique.
Returns the latest price

Returns the amount of funds that LongShort can directly transfer.
 Funds locked in the yield managers have to be withdrawn first.
Returns % of long position that is filled

Returns % of short position that is filled
 zero div error if both are zero

Returns the amount of accrued value that should go to the market,
 and the amount that should be locked into the treasury. To incentivise
 market balance, more value goes to the market in proportion to how
 imbalanced it is.

Returns the amount of accrued value that should go to each side of the
 market. To incentivise balance, more value goes to the weaker side in
 proportion to how imbalanced the market is.
Adjusts the long/short token prices according to supply and value.
Controls what happens with mint/redeem fees.
Controls what happens with accrued yield manager interest.

Updates the value of the long and short sides within the system
 Note this is public. Anyone can call this function.

Calculates fees for the given mint/redeem amount. Users are penalised
 with higher fees for imbalancing the market.
Create a long position
Creates a short position
Creates a long position and stakes it
Creates a short position and stakes it

@dev {LongShort} contract:**** visit https://float.capital *****
  - Ability for users to create synthetic long and short positions on value movements
  - Value movements could be derived from tradional or alternative asset classes, derivates, binary outcomes, etc...
  - Incentive mechansim providing fees to liquidity makers (users on both sides of order book)
Necessary to update system state before any contract actions (deposits / withdraws)
MULTISIG ADMIN FUNCTIONS ///////

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory,string memory,address) external returns (contract SyntheticToken)
function (string memory,string memory,address) external returns (contract SyntheticToken)

documentation.text:
Creates an entirely new long/short market tracking an underlying
 oracle price. Make sure the synthetic names/symbols are unique.
Returns the latest price

Returns the amount of funds that LongShort can directly transfer.
 Funds locked in the yield managers have to be withdrawn first.
Returns % of long position that is filled

Returns % of short position that is filled
 zero div error if both are zero

Returns the amount of accrued value that should go to the market,
 and the amount that should be locked into the treasury. To incentivise
 market balance, more value goes to the market in proportion to how
 imbalanced it is.

Returns the amount of accrued value that should go to each side of the
 market. To incentivise balance, more value goes to the weaker side in
 proportion to how imbalanced the market is.
Adjusts the long/short token prices according to supply and value.
Controls what happens with mint/redeem fees.
Controls what happens with accrued yield manager interest.

Updates the value of the long and short sides within the system
 Note this is public. Anyone can call this function.

Calculates fees for the given mint/redeem amount. Users are penalised
 with higher fees for imbalancing the market.
Create a long position
Creates a short position
Creates a long position and stakes it
Creates a short position and stakes it

devdoc.details: {LongShort} contract:**** visit https://float.capital *****  - Ability for users to create synthetic long and short positions on value movements  - Value movements could be derived from tradional or alternative asset classes, derivates, binary outcomes, etc...  - Incentive mechansim providing fees to liquidity makers (users on both sides of order book)

getLiquidFunds(uint32).notice: Returns the amount of funds that LongShort can directly transfer. Funds locked in the yield managers have to be withdrawn first.

getLongBeta(uint32).notice: Returns % of long position that is filled

getMarketSplit(uint32,uint256).notice: Returns the amount of accrued value that should go to each side of the market. To incentivise balance, more value goes to the weaker side in proportion to how imbalanced the market is.

getShortBeta(uint32).notice: Returns % of short position that is filled zero div error if both are zero

getTreasurySplit(uint32,uint256).notice: Returns the amount of accrued value that should go to the market, and the amount that should be locked into the treasury. To incentivise market balance, more value goes to the market in proportion to how imbalanced it is.

mintLongAndStake(uint32,uint256).notice: Creates a long position and stakes it

mintShortAndStake(uint32,uint256).notice: Creates a short position and stakes it

newSyntheticMarket(string,string,address.notice: Creates an entirely new long/short market tracking an underlying oracle price. Make sure the synthetic names/symbols are unique.
